title: npx hardhat compile fails for solidity version 0.8.15 and hardhat 2.11.x on a linux ec2 instance
body:

Steps to reproduce:

1. npm init
2. npm install --save-dev hardhat
3. use the following hardhat.config.js:
```
/** @type import('hardhat/config').HardhatUserConfig */
module.exports = {
  solidity: {
    compilers: [
      {
        version: "0.8.15",
        settings: {
          optimizer: {
            enabled: true,
            runs: 200000
          }
        }
      }
    ]
  },
  paths: {
    sources: "./contracts"
  },
};
```
4. create contracts/Token.sol with sample contract from docs: https://hardhat.org/tutorial/writing-and-compiling-contracts#writing-smart-contracts
5. npx hardhat compile
```
[ec2-user@ip-1-1-1-1 t]$ npx hardhat compile
Error: write EPIPE
    at afterWriteDispatched (node:internal/stream_base_commons:160:15)
    at writeGeneric (node:internal/stream_base_commons:151:3)
    at Socket._writeGeneric (node:net:795:11)
    at Socket._write (node:net:807:8)
    at writeOrBuffer (node:internal/streams/writable:389:12)
    at _write (node:internal/streams/writable:330:10)
    at Socket.Writable.write (node:internal/streams/writable:334:10)
    at output (/home/ec2-user/t/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/solidity/compiler/index.ts:82:24)
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at NativeCompiler.compile (/home/ec2-user/t/node_modules/hardhat/src/internal/solidity/compiler/index.ts:66:34)
```

System is a default ec2 linux image (Amazon Linux 2 LTS Arm64 AMI 2.0.20210326.0 arm64 HVM gp2):

```
[ec2-user@ip-1-1-1-1 t]$ lscpu
Architecture:        aarch64

BogoMIPS:            243.75

L1i cache:           64K
L2 cache:            1024K
L3 cache:            32768K
NUMA node0 CPU(s):   0-3
Flags:               fp asimd evtstrm aes pmull sha1 sha2 crc32 atomics fphp asimdhp cpuid asimdrdm lrcpc dcpop asimddp ssbs
[ec2-user@ip-1-1-1-1 t]$ cat /etc/os-release
NAME="Amazon Linux"
VERSION="2"
ID="amzn"
ID_LIKE="centos rhel fedora"
VERSION_ID="2"
PRETTY_NAME="Amazon Linux 2"
ANSI_COLOR="0;33"
CPE_NAME="cpe:2.3:o:amazon:amazon_linux:2"
HOME_URL="https://amazonlinux.com/"
```

Downgrading to 2.10.2 fixes the issue and compile works (2.11.1 and 2.11.0 also fail).

Let me know if you need any more information.

This issue is also being [tracked on Linear](https://linear.app/nomic-foundation/issue/HH-1181/npx-hardhat-compile-fails-for-solidity-version-0815-and-hardhat-211x).

We use Linear to manage our development process, but we keep the conversations on Github.

LINEAR-ID: 8bc8ede1-09ee-4fc7-a4d4-8868a6a6b5ec
Thanks for opening the issue! Can you run with --verbose using both versions and post the output here?
Also, are you using an ephemeral vm? Or do you reuse it?

So 2.10.2 doesnt use native compiler, uses solcjs.

VM is reused. It's a long living instance that periodically runs jobs.

Thanks for the info. The problem is that we are incorrectly assuming that every Linux box is x86_64. 

`npx hardhat clean --global` should help you workaround this issue.
Ty, compile worked with 2.11.2 after running `npx hardhat clean --global`.

This should be either fixed in the latest version, or the same underlying problem that in #3195, so I'm going to close it. I will re-open it if it turns out that is still happening after we fix that one.
